org.odk.collect.android.javarosawrapper

Class FormController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.odk.collect.android.javarosawrapper.FormController

  • public class FormController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a wrapper for Javarosa's FormEntryController. In theory, if you wanted to replace javarosa as the form engine, you should only need to replace the methods in this file. Also, we haven't wrapped every method provided by FormEntryController, only the ones we've needed so far. Feel free to add more as necessary.

    • Nested Class Summary

      OpenRosa metadata of a form instance.

      • answerQuestion

        public int answerQuestion(org.javarosa.core.model.FormIndex index,
                          org.javarosa.core.model.data.IAnswerData data)
                   throws JavaRosaException
        Attempts to save answer into the given FormIndex into the data model.
        Throws:
        JavaRosaException

      • validateAnswers

        public int validateAnswers(boolean markCompleted)
                    throws JavaRosaException
        Goes through the entire form to make sure all entered answers comply with their constraints. Constraints are ignored on 'jump to', so answers can be outside of constraints. We don't allow saving to disk, though, until all answers conform to their constraints/requirements.
        Returns:
        ANSWER_OK and leave index unchanged or change index to bad value and return error type.
        Throws:
        JavaRosaException

      • saveAnswer

        public boolean saveAnswer(org.javarosa.core.model.FormIndex index,
                          org.javarosa.core.model.data.IAnswerData data)
                   throws JavaRosaException
        saveAnswer attempts to save the current answer into the data model without doing any constraint checking. Only use this if you know what you're doing. For normal form filling you should always use answerQuestion or answerCurrentQuestion.
        Returns:
        true if saved successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        JavaRosaException

      • stepToNextEvent

        public int stepToNextEvent(boolean stepIntoGroup)
        Navigates forward in the form.
        Returns:
        the next event that should be handled by a view.

      • stepOverGroup

        public int stepOverGroup()
        If using a view like HierarchyView that doesn't support multi-question per screen, step over the group represented by the FormIndex.

      • stepToPreviousScreenEvent

        public int stepToPreviousScreenEvent()
                              throws JavaRosaException
        Move the current form index to the index of the previous question in the form. Step backward out of repeats and groups as needed. If the resulting question is itself within a field-list, move upward to the group or repeat defining that field-list.
        Throws:
        JavaRosaException

      • stepToNextScreenEvent

        public int stepToNextScreenEvent()
                          throws JavaRosaException
        Move the current form index to the index of the next question in the form. Stop if we should ask to create a new repeat group or if we reach the end of the form. If we enter a group or repeat, return that if it is a field-list definition. Otherwise, descend into the group or repeat searching for the first question.
        Throws:
        JavaRosaException

      • stepToNextEventType

        public int stepToNextEventType(int eventType)
        Move the current form index to the next event of the given type (or the end if none is found).

      • stepToOuterScreenEvent

        public int stepToOuterScreenEvent()
        Move the current form index to the index of the first displayable group (that is, a repeatable group or a visible group), or to the start of the form.

      • isDisplayableGroup

        public boolean isDisplayableGroup(org.javarosa.core.model.FormIndex index)
        Returns true if the index is either a repeatable group or a visible group.

      • saveAllScreenAnswers

        public FormController.FailedConstraint saveAllScreenAnswers(java.util.HashMap<org.javarosa.core.model.FormIndex,org.javarosa.core.model.data.IAnswerData> answers,
                                                            boolean evaluateConstraints)
                                                     throws JavaRosaException
        Returns:
        FailedConstraint of first failed constraint or null if all questions were saved.
        Throws:
        JavaRosaException

      • jumpToNewRepeatPrompt

        public void jumpToNewRepeatPrompt()
        Jumps to the next prompt for a repeated instance of the group referenced by the current FormIndex.

      • newRepeat

        public void newRepeat()
        Creates a new repeated instance of the group referenced by the current FormIndex.

      • deleteRepeat

        public void deleteRepeat()
        If the current FormIndex is within a repeated group, will find the innermost repeat, delete it, and jump the FormEntryController to the previous valid index. That is, if you have group1 (2) > group2 (3) and you call deleteRepeat, it will delete the 3rd instance of group2.

      • setLanguage

        public void setLanguage(java.lang.String language)
        Sets the current language.

      • getQuestionPrompts

        public org.javarosa.form.api.FormEntryPrompt[] getQuestionPrompts()
                                                           throws FormDesignException
        Returns an array of question prompts corresponding to the current FormIndex. These are the prompts that should be displayed to the user and don't include any non-relevant questions.

        The array has a single element if there is a question at this FormIndex or multiple elements if there is a group.

        Throws:
        FormDesignException - if there is a group at this FormIndex and it contains elements that are not questions or regular (non-repeat) groups.

      • isGroupRelevant

        public boolean isGroupRelevant()
        Returns:
        true if a group contains at least one relevant question, otherwise false

      • getQuestionPrompt

        public org.javarosa.form.api.FormEntryPrompt getQuestionPrompt(org.javarosa.core.model.FormIndex index)

      • isSubmissionEntireForm

        public boolean isSubmissionEntireForm()
        Once a submission is marked as complete, it is saved in the submission format, which might be a fragment of the original form.
        Returns:
        true if the submission is the entire form. If it is, then the submission can be re-opened for editing after it was marked-as-complete (provided it has not been encrypted).

        public org.javarosa.core.services.transport.payload.ByteArrayPayload getFilledInFormXml()
                                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs the XML payload for a filled-in form instance. This payload enables a filled-in form to be re-opened and edited.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
